required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparisons of the Impact of Duloxetine Versus Imipramine on Therapeutic Efficacy, Psychological Distress, Sexual Function, Urethral and Bladder Wall Structure and Blood Flow in Women With Stress Urinary Incontinence: a Randomized Controlled Study
clinical_study.official_title: Comparisons of the Impact of Duloxetine Versus Imipramine on Therapeutic Efficacy, Psychological Distress, Sexual Function, Urethral and Bladder Wall Structure and Blood Flow in Women With Stress Urinary Incontinence: a Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the impact of Duloxetine and Imipramine on therapeutic efficacy, psychological distress, sexual function, bladder wall structure and blood flow in women

detailed_description.textblock: To assess the impact of Duloxetine and Imipramine on therapeutic efficacy, psychological distress, sexual function, bladder wall structure and blood flow in women

primary_outcome.measure: the score of International Consultation on Incontinence Questionnaire-Urinary Incontinence
primary_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the score of International Consultation on Incontinence Questionnaire-Urinary Incontinence

secondary_outcome.measure: the score of Urgency Severity Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the score of Urgency Severity Scale

other_outcome.measure: the score of Overactive Bladder Symptom Score
other_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the score of Overactive Bladder Symptom Score

other_outcome.measure: the score of King's health questionnaires
other_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the score of King's health questionnaires

other_outcome.measure: the score of Brief symptom rating scale
other_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the score of Brief symptom rating scale

other_outcome.measure: the score of Female sexual function index
other_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the score of Female sexual function index

other_outcome.measure: Blood flow index of the bladder
other_outcome.description: Between-group difference in the changes of blood flow index of the bladder
Between-group difference in the changes of Bladder wall thickness

arm_group.description: Receive Duloxetine 30 mg treatment per day
Receive Imipramine 25 mg treatment per day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stress urinary incontinence
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Take monoamine oxidase
2. Myocardial infarction critical,cardiovascular insufficiency (such as room blocking, arrhythmia, blood-soaked heart failure, myocardial infarction, stroke and excessive heartbeat).
3. Allergy to duloxetine or imipramine
4. Uncontrolled angular glaucoma patients
5. Pregnant women

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Far-Eastern Memorial Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_title: Comparisons of the impact of duloxetine versus imipramine on therapeutic efficacy, psychological distress, sexual function, urethral and bladder wall structure and blood flow in women with stress urinary incontinence: a randomized controlled study
